summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to USAA Federal Savings Bank, demanding extensive financial records for accounts from January 1, 2019 onward. The subpoena is related to an investigation into alleged violations of federal statutes including bribery, conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction. It includes detailed instructions for document production and a reimbursement procedure letter.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying reimbursement procedure letter on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ed Tyrrell
persons.context: Identified in the reimbursement letter as the person to contact for advance permission if estimated billing for subpoena compliance exceeds $500.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands USAA Federal Savings Bank to appear before a grand jury in the Southern District of New York to testify and produce records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued to USAA Federal Savings Bank, demanding financial records.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
USAA Federal Savings Bank, 9800 Fredericksburg Road, San Antonio, TX 78288
U.S. Attorney's Office, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
U.S. Attorney's Office - SDNY Accounts Payable, 86 Chambers Street, 3rd floor, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena targets USAA Federal Savings Bank for financial records from January 1, 2019 onward, indicating an active grand jury investigation at that time.

The investigation involves alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 201 (bribery), 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), 1346 (honest services fraud), 1519 (destruction/alteration of records in federal investigations), and 2 (aiding and abetting).
The requested records are extensive, covering account documents, statements, wire/ACH transfers, check images, and customer identification information.
The subpoena reference number is 2019R01059, and it includes a detailed rider specifying the exact records required and technical instructions for their production.
A separate letter outlines the procedure for the bank to seek reimbursement for costs incurred in complying with the subpoena, referencing the Right to Financial Privacy Act.
